content.question:
In <math alttext="2011" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2011</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="17" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of a random sample of <math alttext="200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> adults in the United States indicated that they consumed at least <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds of bacon that year. In <math alttext="2016" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2016</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of a random sample of <math alttext="600" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>600</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> adults in the United States indicated that they consumed at least <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds of bacon that year.
Assuming all conditions for inference are met, which of the following is the most appropriate test statistic to use to investigate whether the proportion of all adults in the United States who consume at least <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> pounds of bacon in <math alttext="2016" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2016</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is different from that of <math alttext="2011" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2011</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="z equals, the fraction with numerator 0.17 minus 0.25, and denominator, the square root of the fraction with numerator, 0.17 times 0.83, and denominator 200, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator 0.25 times 0.75, and denominator 600, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.17</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.17</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.83</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.25</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.75</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>600</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="z equals, the fraction with numerator 0.17 minus 0.25, and denominator, the square root of, the fraction with numerator, 0.17 times 0.83, and denominator 600, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator 0.25 times 0.75, and denominator 200, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.17</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.17</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.83</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>600</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.25</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.75</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="z equals, the fraction with numerator 0.17 minus 0.25, and denominator, the square root of, 0.21 times 0.79, times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 200 end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over 600, close parenthesis, end square root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.17</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.21</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.79</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>600</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="z equals, the fraction with numerator 0.17 minus 0.25, and denominator, the square root of, 0.23 times 0.77, times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 200 end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over 600, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.17</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.23</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.77</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>600</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="z equals, the fraction with numerator 0.17 minus 0.25, and denominator, the square root of, 0.50 times 0.50, times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 200 end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over 600, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.17</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.50</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.50</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>600</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="z equals, the fraction with numerator 0.17 minus 0.25, and denominator, the square root of, 0.23 times 0.77, times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 200 end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over 600, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.17</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.23</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.77</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>600</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.11: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
